title: Museum Hamburg
content:
Could you help me with this font-id please. I know this file is small but i have no other.

| Attachment | Size |
| --- | --- |
| [947\_kultur\_bilder\_1.jpg](http://web.archive.org/web/20131013173844/http:/typophile.com/files/947_kultur_bilder_1_0.jpg) | 5.78 KB |
author: jawbox

comments.content:
Not Syntax or Lucida Sans, the R is different. Scala also has different R and W.

[Quay Sans](http://web.archive.org/web/20131013173844/http:/www.myfonts.com/fonts/ef/itc-quay-sans/) is closest, but its M is slightly sloping.
I think you nailed it, M. The M on the sample is sloping as well.
I thought of the "foundry form sans". But i can't find an example of the "R"

I think the Foundry idea is good. Form Sans and Journal, both have a similar G, R and M. See the samples in the [Sans Serif Font ID Guide](http://web.archive.org/web/20131013173844/http:/www.bowfinprintworks.com/SansIDPage.html) at Codes 4-61. Quay Sans is at Code 4-62, because I considered the M more sloped.

- Mike Yanega
